intro: Dorstenia foetida subsp. foetida, commonly known as the stinking cotton or stinking fig, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The species is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is thought to attract certain pollinators.
